DOCNAME: CASE OF PÉREZ DE RADA CAVANILLES v. SPAIN
CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6-1;Non-pecuniary damage - finding of violation sufficient;Costs and expenses partial award - Convention proceedings
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant had been in dispute with a neighbour concerning a view over her property at GPE in the province of GPE . On DATE a settlement agreement was concluded between the parties before the deputy judge of first instance at Aoiz ( province of GPE ) . In the agreement the neighbour , who had only a life interest in the building he occupied , undertook to block the view from his patio over the applicant ’s property within DATE .
CARDINAL . When , on DATE , that period expired without the neighbour having carried out his undertaking , the applicant applied to ORG for enforcement of the agreement .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court gave judgment for the applicant and allowed the defendant an additional period of DATE to perform the undertakings made in the agreement .

CARDINAL . On DATE the defendant informed ORG that as he was not the owner of the building he occupied , he could not carry out the works needed to fulfil the terms of the agreement . On DATE the applicant renewed her application , stating that the defendant had not brought any action to have the agreement in question set aside under LAW ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) .

CARDINAL . In a decision ( auto ) of CARDINAL DATE the deputy judge of ORG ( not the same judge as before ) dismissed the applicant ’s application and held that the agreement was void on the ground that the neighbour , who was merely a life tenant , could not carry out the works needed to block the view without the consent of the reversioner , since they would change the appearance and structure of the building . The judge added that there was nothing to prevent an agreement being concluded with the person who had the necessary capacity .

As regards the applicant ’s allegation that the defendant had not raised the nullity of the agreement within the prescribed time ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) , the judge held that LAW covered only cases in which the actual conclusion of the agreement had not complied with the conditions or formalities laid down by law , and not defects such as to negate a consensus ad idem . The agreement was defective because CARDINAL of the parties had no capacity to conclude such an agreement .
CARDINAL . On DATE the registrar of ORG ordered that the decision should be served at the applicant ’s home in the village of GPE , QUANTITY from Aoiz .

CARDINAL . On DATE the magistrate at ORG ( under whose jurisdiction the village of GPE came ) recorded that the applicant was not at her home at GPE and informed the registry at ORG that her husband , who was at the same time her lawyer , had requested by telephone that the decision should be served at the applicant ’s home in GPE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the decision in question was served on the defendant .

CARDINAL . In an order of CARDINAL DATE ORG ( QUANTITY from GPE ) ordered that the decision should be served at the applicant ’s home in GPE ; on DATE the decision was at last served on the applicant in the person of her domestic help , since she herself was out at the time .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged a reposición application and , in the alternative , an ordinary appeal against the decision of CARDINAL DATE with the registry of the duty court in GPE , which initially stamped the document . Noticing , however , that the application should have been lodged at ORG , the head of the registry crossed out the stamp , thereby invalidating it .

On DATE , the applicant sent , by registered letter with advice of delivery , the same reposición application and , in the alternative , an ordinary appeal to ORG . The application was dated DATE and had been signed by the applicant and her counsel at GPE . The first page was DATE .
CARDINAL . The registry of ORG received the application on DATE .

CARDINAL . In a decision ( providencia ) of CARDINAL DATE ORG declared the reposición application and appeal in the alternative inadmissible as being out of time . After a number of unsuccessful attempts by the ORG magistrate and ORG to serve this decision within their jurisdictions , it was served on the applicant at her home in GPE on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant sent to ORG , by registered letter with advice of delivery , a reposición application against the aforementioned decision and this was received at the registry on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG Instance dismissed the application and upheld the impugned decision , on the ground that the application against the decision of DATE should have been registered at the court registry within the prescribed period of DATE , that is to say on DATE at the latest . The court also noted that the legislation on administrative matters cited by the applicant ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) was not applicable in the case as proceedings in the ordinary courts were governed by LAW and LAW ( see paragraphs CARDINAL below ) . Lastly , the Court held that allowing an application to be lodged by post would undermine “ judicial authenticity ” , thereby breaching the principle of legal certainty , inasmuch as a post office ( an administrative entity ) could not be equated with a judicial body .

As to the ordinary appeal , the court added that it could not be lodged until the reposición application had been determined and not at the same time as that application , and that it was accordingly pointless to consider whether it had been lodged timeously .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged an appeal with ORG , which dismissed it in a decision ( auto ) of DATE , emphasising that applications had to be made to the appropriate court or to the duty judge of the same town , particularly where the person making it was assisted by counsel .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged an amparo appeal with ORG , relying on the right to protection by the courts ( LAW ) .
CARDINAL . In a decision of CARDINAL DATE the application was declared inadmissible on the following grounds :

“ … This ORG ’s case - law on the filing of applications ( [ see , ] as a recent authority , ORG judgment no . CARDINAL ) applies to the instant case . Applications are normally to be filed with the registry of the court applied to or with the duty judge and filing [ of an application ] at the headquarters of administrative bodies is , as an exception , permissible only where the litigant is not represented by a lawyer ( abogado or procurador ) . In the instant case the applicant , assisted by counsel , filed her application at a post office ; the ordinary courts , applying the rules of procedure and relying on decisions such as ORG judgment no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , held , in reasoned decisions , that there was no justification for failing to file [ the application ] at the registry of the court itself or with the duty judge in the town . ”
CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL § QUANTITY of the LAW provides :
“ Everyone has the right to effective protection by the courts in the exercise of his rights and his legitimate interests , and in no circumstances may there be any denial of defence rights . ”
CARDINAL . The relevant provisions of LAW which concern settlement agreements read as follows :
Article CARDINAL

“ The terms agreed by the parties to a settlement agreement shall be enforced by the same court before which the agreement was concluded and according to the procedure ( juicio verbal ) laid down for the execution of judgments delivered by a court of first instance where the cases are within the jurisdiction of that court .
Article CARDINAL
“ An action to have the terms of a settlement agreement declared void may be brought on the same grounds as CARDINAL for annulling contracts .
Such an action must be brought in the appropriate court within DATE of the conclusion of the agreement , using the procedure corresponding to the amount in dispute . ”
CARDINAL . The relevant provisions of LAW concerning time - limits and the filing of applications are worded as follows :
Article CARDINAL
“ To be valid , judicial acts must be authorised by the public officer responsible for authenticating or certifying the act . ”
Article CARDINAL

“ Registrars and secretaries [ of courts ] shall enter the date and time of filing of applications only where it is necessary for checking that a mandatory time - limit ( plazo perentorio ) has been complied with . … ”
Article CARDINAL
“ PERSON applications must be filed within DATE and must specify the provision of this Code that is alleged to have been infringed .

Where these CARDINAL requirements have not been satisfied , the court shall , without further consideration , make a declaration , against which no appeal shall lie , that no ruling will be made on the application . ”
CARDINAL . The relevant provisions of LAW are the following :
Section CARDINAL
“ CARDINAL . The rules of good faith must be complied with in all proceedings .
CARDINAL . …

CARDINAL . In accordance with the principle of effective protection laid down in LAW , the courts shall always rule on claims and may only dismiss them on the ground of a formal defect where that defect can not be remedied , or at least not in accordance with the procedure laid down by law [ for that purpose ] . ”
Section CARDINAL(CARDINAL )
“ All judicial acts shall be carried out at the seat of the judicial body . ”
Section CARDINAL

“ Procedural documents , decisions and judgments shall be served on all the parties to a case and also , where expressly so provided in such decisions in accordance with the law , on any persons referred to in them or who may be prejudiced thereby . ”
Section CARDINAL
“ Service may be effected by post , telegraph or any other technical means which record its accomplishment and the circumstances thereof in accordance with the laws on procedure . ”
Section CARDINAL

“ CARDINAL . In municipalities in which there are several courts … , a common service , under the authority of the Chairman of the Bar , may be established in order to effect service where this is the court ’s responsibility .
CARDINAL . …
CARDINAL . General registration departments may likewise be set up for the filing of instruments or other documents intended for judicial bodies . ”
Section CARDINAL(CARDINAL )
“ Registrars shall record DATE and time of lodging of applications , writs and originating summonses and any other document which must be filed within a mandatory ( perentorio ) time - limit . ”
CARDINAL . The relevant provision of PERSON no . CARDINAL of CARDINAL DATE on the rules governing public authorities and on common administrative procedure lays down :
Section CARDINAL(CARDINAL )
“ Applications , pleadings and communications sent by members of the public to public administrative bodies may be filed :
( c ) at post offices , in accordance with the formal requirements laid down in regulations . ”
CARDINAL . The rules on the postal service , as enacted in Decree no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL of CARDINAL DATE and amended by the Order of DATE and Decree no . CARDINAL of DATE , provide :
Article CARDINAL
“ Acceptance of applications and documents sent to administrative institutions
CARDINAL . The documents and applications in question shall be submitted in an open envelope …

CARDINAL . The official who accepts the item for despatch shall stamp it with the date in the upper left - hand corner of the main document , so that the name of the post office and the date of submission are clearly visible … ”

CARDINAL/CARDINAL , ORG ( Boletín oficial del Estado ) of CARDINAL DATE ) ORG , citing its own case - law , held that the right to effective protection by the courts was infringed “ where a member of the public found it impossible to lodge an application on account of undue hindrances or of unjustified and unexplained refusal or of a mistake attributable to the judicial body ” .

In CARDINAL judgments of CARDINAL DATE ( no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , ORG of DATE ) and DATE ( no . DATE , ORG of DATE ) ORG held , inter alia , that the rules of procedure on the acceptance of applications must not prevent the practical exercise of the right to effective protection by the courts . The interpretation of them was not to be excessively or unreasonably strict , regard was to be had to their purpose at the time they were adopted and remedies were to be made as accessible as possible .

CARDINAL . In CARDINAL judgments of DATE ( no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , ORG of DATE ) and DATE ( no . CARDINAL , ORG of DATE ) ORG held that applications were to be filed with the registry of the court applied to or the duty judge of the town – in these cases the appeals had been to ORG itself DATE and posting an application was , as an exception , permissible only where the litigant was not represented by a lawyer ( abogado or procurador ) and lived at a distance from the seat of the court .
